TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {19858=2013 Stepped onto the field 14 times, including making one start in his first year at UMass Boston … Collected nine groundballs and caused three turnovers … Picked up a career-high three groundballs and added a caused turnover March 14 in a 10-9 loss to Wentworth … Registered at least one ground ball in six-straight contests from March 14-April 2 … Earned his first collegiate start April 2 and totaled two groundballs and one caused turnover in a loss at MIT., 20358=PERSONAL/HIGH SCHOOL Transferred to UMass Boston after spending one year at Newbury College … Graduated from Chapel Hill High School in Chapel Hill, NC in 2011 … Four sport athlete in high school (lacrosse, football, track and field, basketball) … Named a Second Team All-Conference selection with the lacrosse team … Earned All-Team MVP and First Team All-Conference honors with the football team … Born on December 7, 1993 … Son of Theresa and Doval Watson … Has five siblings, Isa, Doval, Jessica, Raquel, and Larry … Currently majoring in Accounting., 19066=2014 Ended his junior season as one of the Beacons top midfielders having appeared in all 18 games, earning the start in 16 of those … Collected a total of six points (4g, 2a) and finished second on the team in groundballs with 55 … Also forced 11 turnovers during the year … Had his best offensive game on March 11 when he scored two goals in the 16-4 win over Thomas College (Maine) … Recorded a career-best eight groundballs and also had two caused turnovers in the March 5 game at Gordon College … Picked-up six groundballs in the 17-1 win over Johnson State College on March 15 … Registered his third goal of the season on March 20 in Florida against SUNY Geneseo … Tallied his second assist of the campaign in the March 22 win over Emerson College.}
